name: Happy, Healthy, Helpful "H" Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which character is found in "Silence of the Lambs"?
questions.explanation:
Hannibal Lecter.

	Hannibal Lecter was played by Anthony Hopkins.

questions.text: Who wrote the book "The Scarlet Letter"?
questions.explanation:
Hawthorne, Nathaniel.

	"The Scarlet Letter" is about a woman who has an affair with the town minister.  As a result she has a child named Pearl. The woman is forced to wear an A as a symbol of her adultery.

questions.text: Who wrote the lyrics for "South Pacific"?
questions.explanation:
Hammerstein, Oscar.

	Oscar Hammerstein II was named after his grandfather Oscar Hammerstein. The last musical that Hammerstein wrote lyrics for was "The Sound of Music" in 1959. He died in 1960.

questions.text: What is another word for home?
questions.explanation:
habitat.

	There are many kinds of habitats that animals live in. Some animals live in the rainforest, some the jungle, others perhaps may live in the woods. There are others too, but you get the idea.

questions.text: Fill in the blank from this quote by Benjamin Franklin: "Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man __________, wealthy and wise."
questions.explanation:
healthy.

	Ben Franklin was famous for many other quotes as well. Many can be found in his book, "Poor Richard's Almanac."

questions.text: On "Cheers" what is Norm's (played by George Wendt) real first name?
questions.explanation:
Hilary.

	Norm gets teased when his fellow barmates find out his real name is Hilary.

questions.text: What was the name of Punky Brewster's foster father on "Punky Brewster"?
questions.explanation:
Henry.

	Henry was played by George Gaynes.

questions.text: Who was the MVP of the 1997 Superbowl?
questions.explanation:
Howard, Desmond.

	Desmond Howard played for the Green Bay Packers. He was the kick return specialist. The Packers won against New England Patriots       35-21.

questions.text: What college did Bill Gates drop out of?
questions.explanation:
Harvard.

	Bill Gates was born October 28, 1955. He went to Harvard to become a lawyer like his father. After dropping out when he created "Microsoft" he became a billionaire by age 31.

questions.text: Which of these is a holiday or special day?
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	All these holidays actually exist somewhere in the world.
